intro: Pronaya fraseri, commonly known as the Fraser's pronaya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
